page.title: 03LANDSCAPE, ELMLEY CASTLE
page.content: Landscape is "subdued relief" rising from the North-eastern Avon valley footslopes (40m) to the plateau of Bredon hill (290m).The field pattern around Kersoe,Netherton, and Brickle- hampton is mixed arable - winter wheat,barley,ryegrass and potatoes and market garden allotments - salad onions,runner beans and asparagus. Architecturally, nucleated "street" village settlements are grouped around the Church/Manor house.Ridge and furrow occur south-west of Little Comberton and the Roman "Saltway" traverses Netherton fields.Spurs and valleys at 160m are mainly forestry planted with conifers (Norway Spruce) and deciduous hardwoods (Sweet Chestnut).Elmley "castle" and moat remains occur on the cap-rock while above,cleared scrubland and rough grazing scree-slopes bear footpaths.
